comment: Goods: Clear, and no mandatory attendance or homework. Bads: fast, tends to teach as if you already know it, gives pretty hard tests (although his tests usually have as much if not more extra credit than the test is actually worth), and is NEVER available for outside help. Bottom line: take him if youre good at trig, avoid him at all costs if not.

very inconsiderate. cant teach. rude. sweats a lot. makes everything harder than it should be. i retook this class with a different teacher and made an A with no struggle. he does not allow retakes and is very willing to give Fs. he should not be aloud to hold a students future in his hands... an F can really mess up your future.
awful teacher. needs to be fired. i have not heard of a single person that did not struggle. on grades come from tests. final is 50%

Terrible teacher. I love math, but this man made it so unenjoyable. Not only are his lectures terribly boring, he cannot teach.  He reviews the material like you are supposed to already know it.  Your only grades come from tests and the final is 50%.  4 kids passed in my class out of the 8 who actually took the final. We started with 34 people.
This class will be very challenging if you're not a strong math person! Your only grades are tests. Take notes on the lectures and do the homework if you want to make a good grade.

Definitely do not take him if you are not sure about trig. He expects you to understand as soon as it comes out of his mouth. Doesn't take attendance, but has a quiz in the first five minutes of almost each class, so don't be late. Not very helpful.

This is NOT the kind of teacher you want to take. His in-class teaching is weak at best, and there is a mandatory quiz at the beginning of every class. If you are even 2 minutes late, you lose final grade points. If you are late or absent 3 times, you lose 1 letter grade. Awful teacher

Attendance is mandatory because you have a quiz every day, and each quiz counts toward your final grade. The homework was torture. He would assign every single problem in the book for that section (100+ problems), and his only advice for studying was to do the assignment twice. His lectures weren't helpful. VERY HARD CLASS. AVOID.

Holy dang, if you are about to take him for Linear Algebra, you need to reconsider. Going to this class was so pointless, except for the fact he gives random quizzes that count toward your final grade. There is no online information, so if you miss class you will have no idea what you missed or what exams are... and he sweats like no one i've seen.

Dr. Davis has a tremendous knowledge of Computer Science and programming.  However, his teaching methods left a little to be desired.  He would hand write code on the board for examples of concepts he was teaching.  In this class, though, that's not the best way to teach as we could not see how the code compiled and ran in the IDE we used.
